chunks.chunk_text: about Taiwan bentos.But Clem,Taiwan Railway Bento is a signature.It's iconic.Something we can share with international visitors.But in Taiwan, there's actually more buffet-styled bento restaurant, isn't it?Everywhere you can see buffet-style bento restaurants.To me, buffet-style bento restaurant is weird.Why?Okay.Because to me in the West, when we go to a buffet restaurant, it's all you can eat.But this buffet-style bento restaurant is

chunks.chunk_text: you get to choose the dishes.The dishes are laid out in front of you and you get to pick what you want.Correct?So my association of buffet and all you can eat is different.So sometimes...So the first time I saw these bento restaurants and I was talking to my friends from America and I would call it a cafeteria-style bento restaurant.Like school cafeteria.You know, you go to the school cafeteria.

chunks.chunk_text: And the braised pork.I know about all those across the board.They are readily available at most of these stores.But which one, if I'm like an international visitor, which one would you recommend me to start off with?I suggest to start with braised pork chops first.Braised pork chops.Why?I see.And it's a signature, isn't it?

chunks.chunk_text: Because personally, I like fried foods.But having it fried first then braised is a different texture altogether.So it's definitely a signature.It's a Taiwan signature.People in Taiwan do this.Yeah, for sure.We only do this for pork chops.We don't do this for chicken drumsticks, right?No.Only do this to pork chops.Yes.So I think another bento store that's super famous, Formosa Chang,胡西章, they also do braised pork chops.

chunks.chunk_text: I'm okay with crunchy.So there's another crunchy dish, side dish that's usually quite common in all these bento stores is dried bamboo shoots.So is that better than radish?Better than radish to me.Okay.My mom always orders the bamboo shoots.She loves bamboo shoots.Me, 50-50.Sometimes I think they're too much fiber.Too much fiber?Yeah.Too much fiber.Isn't it healthy?I mean,

chunks.chunk_text: only when I'm having a bad stomach day, right?If I, you know, if I'm plugged and I need fiber, then I would actively ask for bamboo shoots.But in general, I think sometimes the bamboo shoots are just really too fibery for me.You know, there's just too much fiber in the mouth.So as opposed to bamboo shoots, I would go for green veggies.So here is the biggest question of them all, Clem.And this is something

chunks.chunk_text: foreigners love but people in Taiwan hate.When I go to bento restaurants.I know what you're talking about.Yes.We have to talk about this because this is so weird for foreigners, right?In the West, we have for fried rice, for a lot of Chinese foods.And even at home, as a side dish, you get frozen veggies.These frozen veggie packs, right?Cubed carrots, peas, right?
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_英語咖啡館 Ep.261_ 外國人最愛之台灣便當店與最知名的台鐵便當 Taiwan Railways bento and ubiquitous buffet.json

chunks.chunk_text: And corn kernels.So these three colors, we put in a pack called frozen vegetables.My mom doesn't understand it.She doesn't think they are vegetables.But to the Westerners, that's vegetables, right?Most Taiwanese people don't think these are vegetables.Yes.But my brother and I, we grew up in the West.So it makes sense.It's like, hey, frozen veggies.This is cool.And my mom says, why did you buy that?Yeah.Most people will ask you why
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_英語咖啡館 Ep.261_ 外國人最愛之台灣便當店與最知名的台鐵便當 Taiwan Railways bento and ubiquitous buffet.json

chunks.chunk_text: would you buy that?So for bento restaurants, most of the time, you would also see these frozen veggies stir-fried.Would you order it as a side dish?Never.Never.I noticed with people in Taiwan, they hate these frozen veggies.I don't know why.I am OK with it.And I actually think it's great with fried rice.Because we live in Taiwan and we have lots of farms.So we can
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_英語咖啡館 Ep.261_ 外國人最愛之台灣便當店與最知名的台鐵便當 Taiwan Railways bento and ubiquitous buffet.json

chunks.chunk_text: eat fresh vegetables.Why should we eat frozen?Well, I mean, sure.Good question.Why?Yeah.But in the West, it's colorful, right?In your fried rice, it makes good color.As a side dish, in your bento box, it's colorful, right?Yellow, orange, and green.Lovely.And you love peas, I remember.Yeah.So why don't you order it?What's wrong with it?Because I could order fresh beans.You prefer fresh beans.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_英語咖啡館 Ep.261_ 外國人最愛之台灣便當店與最知名的台鐵便當 Taiwan Railways bento and ubiquitous buffet.json

chunks.chunk_text: So when you see those three colors combined, you know it's frozen food.You know that is like microwave frozen food.You will stay away from it.OK.Got it.So it's not about the vegetable itself.It's about you know it's not fresh.To me, I know it's not fresh.And the flavor is not that good.What do you mean the flavor is not that good?It's fantastic.It's fantastic.You should try fresh corn.The fresh corn is very, very delicious.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_英語咖啡館 Ep.261_ 外國人最愛之台灣便當店與最知名的台鐵便當 Taiwan Railways bento and ubiquitous buffet.json

chunks.chunk_text: It's sweet, juicy.Yeah.But the frozen ones are just as juicy.They're not bad.They're not that bad.OK.But anyways.So for me, it's kind of weird.I know for most people, it's also cheap veggies, right?They consider that frozen veggies cheap veggies too.Some of the green leaf veggies, they're more expensive.So when you go to a buffet restaurant, a buffet bento store, you probably would order something fresher, something that's
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_英語咖啡館 Ep.261_ 外國人最愛之台灣便當店與最知名的台鐵便當 Taiwan Railways bento and ubiquitous buffet.json

chunks.chunk_text: you know considered upscale, a little higher in class, right?Not the low class veggies that Westerners love to eat.Correct.I was being sarcastic.OK.Don't agree with me.All right.So eggplant.I'm not a big eggplant guy, but I'm big frozen veggie guy.OK.Give me frozen veggies in my fried rice.I love you.All right.And I'll ask you, would you pick, would you see curry in the
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_英語咖啡館 Ep.261_ 外國人最愛之台灣便當店與最知名的台鐵便當 Taiwan Railways bento and ubiquitous buffet.json

chunks.chunk_text: bento restaurant?If I go to a bento restaurant and on the buffet table, I see curry.I won't touch it.Oh.I'm not the curry guy there.Oh.You're not a curry guy.If I want curry, I would go to a curry restaurant.OK.See.Most Taiwanese people love curry, but the bento restaurant curry is not curry.It's too much terminics.So it's frozen.Very weird.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_英語咖啡館 Ep.261_ 外國人最愛之台灣便當店與最知名的台鐵便當 Taiwan Railways bento and ubiquitous buffet.json

chunks.chunk_text: Come again.Seriously.Yeah.Bento restaurant curry is not curry.It's just full of turmeric and it's fluorescent.Yeah.I don't, I didn't notice that.OK.Maybe Nick.So what will happen if it's fluorescent?It'll glow in the dark.Like if you turn the lights off and it'll go ding.Wow.OK.And the flavor.Yes.Very watery.Very watery yet.Yeah.That's not the kind of curry I'm into.I'm sorry.Yes.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_英語咖啡館 Ep.261_ 外國人最愛之台灣便當店與最知名的台鐵便當 Taiwan Railways bento and ubiquitous buffet.json

chunks.chunk_text: So I go to a cafeteria restaurant.I expect their stir-fried vegetables to be on point and I expect their tofu to be nice and soft and their fried meats, you know, properly fried.And I'm happy with that.Curry.I don't know.I would go to a curry restaurant.Why would I want to buy curry at a bento store?It's weird for me at least.But I suppose, you know, different stroke for different folks, right?Everybody likes things differently.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_英語咖啡館 Ep.261_ 外國人最愛之台灣便當店與最知名的台鐵便當 Taiwan Railways bento and ubiquitous buffet.json

chunks.chunk_text: And the nice thing about buffet restaurants is that they give you variety.Today you like fish.You have fish.Tomorrow you like curry.You have curry.The day after that you like, like me, if you love frozen veggies, then you go ahead and have frozen veggies for lunch.So that's the best part about Taiwan because we give people variety.OK.You don't go to a bento store and there's no variety.It doesn't exist in Taiwan.That's why Taiwan is a foodie country.Go Taiwan.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_英語咖啡館 Ep.261_ 外國人最愛之台灣便當店與最知名的台鐵便當 Taiwan Railways bento and ubiquitous buffet.json

chunks.chunk_text: Yes.Right.So we talked about the buffet style bento boxes and general bento boxes.But we have to come back to the TRA bentos.All right?Because TRA bentos, they've got a lot of history and they are a lot of bentos where it's location based.So where should we start,Clem?Let's start from north.So have you heard about Qidu?Yes.Qidu.I've always
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_英語咖啡館 Ep.261_ 外國人最愛之台灣便當店與最知名的台鐵便當 Taiwan Railways bento and ubiquitous buffet.json

chunks.chunk_text: heard about Qidu, but I've never taken the TRA to Qidu before.Never.So what's so special about Qidu?
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_英語咖啡館 Ep.261_ 外國人最愛之台灣便當店與最知名的台鐵便當 Taiwan Railways bento and ubiquitous buffet.json

chunks.chunk_text: And the soy bread's hard boiled egg.That's right.And I heard Qidu station's classic option is also the fried chicken leg bento, which features a large well-seasoned piece of crispy fried chicken with two-some skin and tender meat.Super crispy, super juicy.I'm yet to try it because I only buy bento, TRA bento at the Taipei main station.So I hear if you go to Qidu, you can get something special.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_英語咖啡館 Ep.261_ 外國人最愛之台灣便當店與最知名的台鐵便當 Taiwan Railways bento and ubiquitous buffet.json

chunks.chunk_text: Apparently the chicken is accompanied by finely shredded pork floss, pickled cucumbers, steamed cabbage and soy marinated hard boiled egg.That's the Qidu station's classic.Shredded pork floss, I think that's kind of interesting because I usually have that with congee and not with my bento.What's next?
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_英語咖啡館 Ep.261_ 外國人最愛之台灣便當店與最知名的台鐵便當 Taiwan Railways bento and ubiquitous buffet.json

chunks.chunk_text: So for vegetarians, they also get quite a variety.So in Taiwan, vegetarian bento is also very, very popular because sometimes people just don't want that big meat or fried meat.So they would opt for vegetarian
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_英語咖啡館 Ep.261_ 外國人最愛之台灣便當店與最知名的台鐵便當 Taiwan Railways bento and ubiquitous buffet.json

chunks.chunk_text: bento.Again, I'm calling out the vegetarian bento because pickled seaweed salad.Thank you.I love my seaweed.Whenever I see seaweed, I give a thumbs up to the bento.All right.And let me tell you a little tip.If you find it difficult to find lunch boxes to buy bento at Taipei station, you can just go to Qidu.Okay.If you have time, right?Because Qidu is like 30 minutes away.Yeah.Because the temperature is just right in Qidu.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_英語咖啡館 Ep.261_ 外國人最愛之台灣便當店與最知名的台鐵便當 Taiwan Railways bento and ubiquitous buffet.json

chunks.chunk_text: 所以我剛才會說溫度是正確的。

chunks.chunk_text: Temperature is correct.It's not cold.Fantastic.Okay.That's Qidu.So coming down.What's next?Regional Signature Bento.Regional Signature Bento.Okay.You know I'm from Qiaoyi.So let's talk about the Qiaoyi station.There's a Alishan railway.There's a station called Fenqi Hu.Super famous.Yes.So Fenqi Hu station bento.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_英語咖啡館 Ep.261_ 外國人最愛之台灣便當店與最知名的台鐵便當 Taiwan Railways bento and ubiquitous buffet.json

chunks.chunk_text: No.You guys get a special box.You get a metal box for Fenqi Hu.We get a wooden box or like a paper bento box in Taipei.Oh.So you can collect the metal tin box.Nice.Fenqi Hu.Very, very cool.And going down.Where else?

chunks.chunk_text: Fulong regional signatures.There's a place called Fulong.Fulong beach.Yeah.Fulong beach.Yes.And there's a Fulong beach bento.What's it called?You've ever heard Fulong Shanghai bento?I call it the Fulong bento.Because the last time Gavin told me, he took his daughter to Fulong and they had bento.And he says, oh, it's always there.He likes to go to Fulong every year.I've never been to Fulong.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_英語咖啡館 Ep.261_ 外國人最愛之台灣便當店與最知名的台鐵便當 Taiwan Railways bento and ubiquitous buffet.json

chunks.chunk_text: No.There's a bento place.So it's called Xiangye bento.Yeah.And it's famous for using fatty pork belly and Taiwanese sausage.In their bentos.Interesting.So fatty pork belly and sausage.Not bad.I would like it.Why not?If I'm at the beach, I suppose I'll eat anything.There's a famous station in the east called Taitung Chi Sheng.Ah.I've heard about that.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_英語咖啡館 Ep.261_ 外國人最愛之台灣便當店與最知名的台鐵便當 Taiwan Railways bento and ubiquitous buffet.json

chunks.chunk_text: And it's a franchise bento brand too.Right.Chi Sheng bento.Yes.But actually you want to go to Taitung for this.There's a town.Chi Sheng.So what's their signature?The signature comes in the resident wooden box.Oh.So the wooden box is a Chi Sheng signature.Yeah.So in Taipei, we also get Chi Sheng bento.That's a copy.I think the Chi Sheng bento is just a brand.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_英語咖啡館 Ep.261_ 外國人最愛之台灣便當店與最知名的台鐵便當 Taiwan Railways bento and ubiquitous buffet.json

chunks.chunk_text: Yeah.Because so sometimes when you go to these bento stores and they give you like a kind of a wooden box.Isn't that like a copy of Chi Sheng bento concept?They don't give you the paper box.They give you a wooden box.But I like the wooden box.You have some wood aroma with the rice.Oh.I can't say if I know wood or if I want wooden smell in my rice.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_英語咖啡館 Ep.261_ 外國人最愛之台灣便當店與最知名的台鐵便當 Taiwan Railways bento and ubiquitous buffet.json

chunks.chunk_text: But OK.OK.To me, it's just a packaging.I mean, we have to recycle it and throw it away anyway.So Chi Sheng, they have wooden boxed bentos.And which of these signature bentos are the most expensive or what are they priced around?Most bentos are priced very affordably at around 50 to $120.Really?Really?This is 2025.No bento in Taipei.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_英語咖啡館 Ep.261_ 外國人最愛之台灣便當店與最知名的台鐵便當 Taiwan Railways bento and ubiquitous buffet.json

chunks.chunk_text: In the north is $180.Most of the bentos are $130 to $150.And $50 stores are gone.I used to love $50 bento stores.They don't exist anymore.It's sad.Inflation has hit us.But still, bentos are still priced very affordably compared to all other fast food brands and fast food stores.If you go to Moss Burger today,how much would a lunch cost you,Clem?
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_英語咖啡館 Ep.261_ 外國人最愛之台灣便當店與最知名的台鐵便當 Taiwan Railways bento and ubiquitous buffet.json

chunks.chunk_text: I think at least $120.Yes.For your small appetite,$120.Easy,right?Just for the burger.For me, the last time I ordered a full meal,$210.No way.Yeah.Yes way.Burger.Burger plus their combo number one.Number one combo.I paid $210.$210.I was shocked.OK.I'm so poor.I can't afford to eat Moss Burger right now.So bento stores are still quite affordable.

chunks.chunk_text: You're killing the sponsor.Well,we shouldn't be killing sponsors,but hey,you know,like Moss Burger,maybe,you know,give me a lifetime free burger access,then I will,you know,I will say go eat Moss Burger,right?I need big sponsorships.I love burgers,but Moss Burger,come on,right?

chunks.chunk_text: OK.OK.OK.OK.

chunks.chunk_text: I think that's a fair comment.Yeah.That's how you determined what to eat in Taiwan,you know?Long lines of course,usually that's the super popular one and the restaraunt that has no customers at lunch stay away from them,yeah.Yeah.In Taiwan,it's important.Yes.
